channel.title: Working out
channel.description:
I've been working out a lot in the past month and a half, and now, since I'm home and have no access to my college gym, I'm planning on trying P90X (an intense exercise program) rather than joining my local gym. I have lost around 15-16 pounds while toning my body and putting on a lot more muscle in the last 45 days. (Fatty arms to visible biceps and triceps now. ;D)
I am 5' 10" (69 inches). I went from 188 pounds a month and a half ago to 172 pounds as of now. I'm looking either to reach my goal of 160 pounds within the next four months, but then again, numbers mean nothing. I'd rather build muscle and stay the same weight.
I'm really just looking to build muscle, because I think I've lost enough weight already. In the end, it's more about my physique than my actual weight.
I'm looking for tips on working out and what supplements to take, etc. I'm going to stick with my plan of P90X for 3 months, while doing free weights, etc. I am going to take some protein, the Muscle Milk brand (only after workouts, because it's expensive).
Any comments, questions, or tips would be appreciated! Oh, and please, I'd rather have people respond from personal experience because anyone can use Google and give me a shit ton of information. (Believe me, I've researched a lot already, but I'd rather have people that have personal experience with working out give me some tips!) ..I also don't really know how active members on here are.... I know I'm pretty active, haha..
Thanks everyone.

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Just finished my 5th day! I’ll be sure to post before and after pictures after the 90 days!

I just bought resistance bands as a substitute for the pull up bar, since I basically broke my ass today when the bar came off the wall. Ass hurts like hell, don’t know if my coccyx is bruised/injured.

Anyways, the bands are really good for guys who can’t do pull ups like me.

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:45, topic:441340”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=544032.msg3989707#msg3989707 date=1336406416]

I don’t know about just working out. That’s just plain bullshit to me. Just working out gives you those fake muscles you’ve always wanted, but in the end you’re as weak as you were before.

What I do is, Thaiboxing, 5 times a week, for getting real strength, not fake fitness strength. And on those left over 2 days I just go out running for an hour. That is really all you need in life. I eat what I want, when I want. The running burns my fat. When you run, you gotta make sure you dress really warm, to accelerate the sweating process. The more you sweat, the more fat you burn. Aside from that, if I have time and if I’m in the mood I do regular pushups, situps,… at home.

to you it’s plain bullshit because obviously it never worked for you because you didn’t work out properly.

try the insanity workout o.o or find some shit about it, i heard its insane
[/quote]

Insanity is fun also.

@MistaBigBoss: “The more you sweat, the more fat you burn.” – That’s water weight. You could lose 15 pounds in 2 days by excessively sweating, which happens in the real world (weight classes for sports, etc), but you would gain it back in the next two days. In general though, if you sweat a lot, it probably means you’re exercising more, which means you burn more fat, but your statement as is is false.[/quote]Yeah, I recently did some research and found out it was not fat but water weight. Guess that means I can leave my sweater at home.

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I can’t remember the name of this one workout my friend is doing. It’s like body weight exercises and running; lots of it. There’s also this one workout a kid is doing to get ready for college football. It’s like, “The bars of death” or something. You rep as much weight as you can eight times 3 sets. And you rotate between bench, squat, and deadlift. On the next day you do lots of running, lunges, and dumbell presses. Then the next day you go back to the squats bench and dumbell.

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:44, topic:441340”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=544032.msg3987882#msg3987882 date=1336171943]
I don’t know about just working out. That’s just plain bullshit to me. Just working out gives you those fake muscles you’ve always wanted, but in the end you’re as weak as you were before.

What I do is, Thaiboxing, 5 times a week, for getting real strength, not fake fitness strength. And on those left over 2 days I just go out running for an hour. That is really all you need in life. I eat what I want, when I want. The running burns my fat. When you run, you gotta make sure you dress really warm, to accelerate the sweating process. The more you sweat, the more fat you burn. Aside from that, if I have time and if I’m in the mood I do regular pushups, situps,… at home.
[/quote]
to you it’s plain bullshit because obviously it never worked for you because you didn’t work out properly.

try the insanity workout o.o or find some shit about it, i heard its insane[/quote]

Insanity is fun also.

@MistaBigBoss: “The more you sweat, the more fat you burn.” – That’s water weight. You could lose 15 pounds in 2 days by excessively sweating, which happens in the real world (weight classes for sports, etc), but you would gain it back in the next two days. In general though, if you sweat a lot, it probably means you’re exercising more, which means you burn more fat, but your statement as is is false.

EDIT: Just did Yoga X. God, the first half was hard…

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:39, topic:441340”]inb4stork
Jc, just out of curiosity, how much do you bench and back squat? We are literally almost the same size. I’m 5’10 and I weighed 173.0 pounds with all of my clothing on yesterday (khakis and shirt no shoes).

If you are a serious body builder you are supposed to take like 1-1.5 grams/lb you weigh.[/quote]

I’m 5’ 10" and I’m around 170 lbs now. I just recently started benching, so I can only bench 120 with good form.

I’m taking ~40g protein post workout as of now. The other protein comes from food.

EDIT: I’ve done 3 days of P90X and must say it’s intense! I love plyo though!

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:41, topic:441340”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=544032.msg3989595#msg3989595 date=1336373773]
You do realize the average person consumes more than enough protein anyway?
[/quote]
I only eat like 100 grams of protein max. If I went by that rule I would need around 200 grams per day.[/quote]

I consume extra protein when I do a full body workout and I’ve put on 20lbs since fall.

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Dont train to look like a body builder, like yz said.

I started working out because I knew being a nerd would make me really skinny. When youre skinny and a nerd you’re a geek/video game nerd, when youre toned/builtish and a nerd youre a “smart cute guy” It generally shows others that you are nerdy but you go out of your way to take care of yourself, its a decent tradeoff.

LOL

Read full topic
